title: The world's best tourist destination is...
text: The inhospitable terrain of the Ethiopia's desert basin also features many acid pools. Hide Caption 6 of 13 13 photos: Ethiopian appeal A salt worker and his camels cross the Danakil Depression in Northern Ethiopia. The landscape is one of harshest on earth, with wastelands of salt and sweltering temperatures that remain well over 100 degrees Fahrenheit. Hide Caption 7 of 13 13 photos: Ethiopian appeal Raw, immense and majestically beautiful, the Erta Ale volcanic crater also sits within the Danakil Depression. Known for being the world's oldest active lava lake, the locals call it "the gateway to hell". Hide Caption 8 of 13 13 photos: Ethiopian appeal Wine lovers can find unexpected sights in the country, like this winery outside the town of Ziway, central Ethiopia. Beyond the donkeys on a potholed road there are vineyards bursting with merlot, syrah and chardonnay grapes ripening in the African sun. Hide Caption 9 of 13 13 photos: Ethiopian appeal Ethiopia has a burgeoning fashion industry. It is known for its intricately woven cotton fabrics, and emerging designers such as Fikirte Addis and Liya Kebede are putting Addis Ababa firmly on the fashion map. Hide Caption 10 of 13 13 photos: Ethiopian appeal Another UNESCO World Heritage site is the tiny village of Negash, which was home to Ethiopia's first Muslim communities and is one of the most important sites in Islam. Legend has it that the Prophet Mohammed's daughter lived her for a time. Hide Caption 11 of 13 13 photos: Ethiopian appeal In the eastern city of Harar, this building is known as Arthur Rimbaud's house after the famous French poet who visited the area. It was actually built by an Indian merchant on the site of an earlier house where Rimbaud is said to have lived. Hide Caption 12 of 13 13 photos: Ethiopian appeal One of the colourful painted alleyways in Harar's Jugal, the 16th-century fortification within the modern city. Hide Caption 13 of 13 Ethiopia has been named as the world's best destination for tourists in 2015 by the European Council on Tourism and Trade . What makes the country unique? More from Travel
